H0.text: Comparing data is the activity best describing Chris’s action of stirring a cup of hot chocolate with a wooden stick, believing it will stay cooler than a metal spoon.

H1.text: Asking a question is the activity that best describes Chris’s action of stirring a cup of hot chocolate with a wooden stick, thinking it will stay cooler than a metal spoon.

H2.text: Making a prediction is the activity that best describes Chris’s action of stirring hot chocolate with a wooden stick because he thinks it will stay cooler than a metal spoon.

H3.text: Forming a conclusion is the activity that best describes Chris's action of stirring a cup of hot chocolate with a wooden stick, thinking the stick will stay cooler than a metal spoon.

A5.text: An experiment usually tests a hypothesis, which is an expectation about how a particular process or phenomenon works.
